snippet: Three days before the downing of a Malaysian civilian airliner, a Ukrainian transport plane was shot down by a surface-to-air missile while flying at 21,000 feet.
abstract: Downing of Malaysian civilian airliner, as well as Ukrainian transport plane which was struck down three days earlier by a surface-to-air missile while flying at 21,000 feet, suggests that powerful weapons are now in hands of rebels or that Russia played a role.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON, MARK MAZZETTI and C. J. CHIVERS
byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon and Mark Mazzetti reported from Washington, and C. J. Chivers from the United States. Matthew L. Wald contributed reporting from Washington, and Nicola Clark from Paris.

lead_paragraph: Three days before the downing of a Malaysian civilian airliner, a Ukrainian transport plane was shot down by a surface-to-air missile while flying at 21,000 feet.

headline.main: Earlier Downing of Transport Plane Over Ukraine Foreshadowed Tragedy
headline.print_headline: Danger Reaches Higher, Suggesting More Powerful Weapons at Hand
